channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Matthew Knott
item.description: The Prime Minister has sought to calm Indonesian President Joko Widodo’s concerns that the AUKUS submarine pact will lead to a new arms race in the Indo-Pacific.
item.title: Morrison seeks to calm Indonesia, Europe sub concerns ahead of US visit

item.description: A student opened fire at a university in Russia, leaving six people dead and 28 hurt, before being shot by police and detained, officials said.
item.title: Several killed in Russian university shooting

item.description: President Joe Biden will ease foreign travel restrictions to the US beginning in November, allowing foreigners into the country if they have proof of vaccination and a negative COVID-19 test.
item.title: US to require international travellers to be vaccinated against COVID-19

item.dc:creator: Heather McNeill
item.description: The scenario paints a bleak picture for rural areas with lower than average vaccination rates, and could lead to some towns being shut off from the rest of the state.
item.title: COVID would reach WA’s regions within weeks of outbreak, modelling shows

item.dc:creator: Nick Miller
item.description: Many artists have been unable to present work created for cancelled exhibitions and festivals: the Melbourne Art Fair will be a chance to show it off.
item.title: Melbourne’s art fair set to return with huge February show

item.description: Christian Porter’s resignation from the ministry should not be an end to the “blind trust” matter. The public should be told who has bankrolled his legal fees.
item.title: Porter’s secretive behaviour should disqualify him from Parliament

item.description: Trivia buffs: test your knowledge with today’s interactive superquiz and target.
item.title: Target Time and Superquiz, Tuesday, September 21

item.dc:creator: Harry Hollinsworth
item.description: Gai Waterhouse left the Supreme Court yesterday with renewed hope of obtaining her training licence.
item.title: In the Herald: September 21, 1991

item.dc:creator: Thomas Keneally
item.description: Forty years ago, we finally had a dictionary to call our own. But the Macquarie was more than a collection of Australian slang, as Thomas Keneally found out.
item.title: From the Archives, 1981: A dictionary by Australians, for Australians

item.description: Sitting there staring out at a virus-riddled city, the entire quarantine machine seemed like a massive waste of time, manpower and resources.
item.title: Now is the time to trial home quarantine for returned travellers

item.dc:creator: Cara Waters
item.description: Fast-growing Australian payments startup Airwallex has secured a fresh round of funding, valuing it at $US4 billion ($5.5 billion) on paper.
item.title: ‘Wave of global unicorns’: Airwallex hits $5.5 billion valuation

item.description: Some of his best work
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Andrew Dyson

item.description: The latest work by Sydney Morning Herald editorial cartoonist Cathy Wilcox.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Cathy Wilcox

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, September 21, 2021

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, September 20, 2021

item.description: Queen Elizabeth’s granddaughter has given birth to a baby girl, her first child with husband Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi, Buckingham Palace announced on Monday.
item.title: Princess Beatrice, Queen Elizabeth’s granddaughter, gives birth to baby girl

item.description: The outcome of the months-long trial of Paul Rusesabagina will be a surprise to few.
item.title: Man who inspired ‘Hotel Rwanda’ film found guilty of terrorism-related charges

item.description: Pfizer says its COVID-19 vaccine works for younger children and that it will seek US approval soon – a key step toward beginning vaccinations for those currently ineligible.
item.title: Pfizer says COVID-19 vaccine works in kids aged 5 to 11

item.description: That comes in vanilla, caramel and mocha.
item.title: The economic divide is a fine line

item.dc:creator: Zach Hope
item.description: As businesses call for certainty, Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk floats double dose targets ranging from 80 per cent to 90 per cent.
item.title: ‘Cancelling Christmas’: Tourism peak warns against 90 per cent double dose target

item.dc:creator: Ben Schneiders
item.description: The Andrews government will announce the closure of the building industry after a day of violent protests outside the Victorian headquarters of the CFMEU.
item.title: Construction industry to be shut down for two weeks after clashes at CFMEU

item.dc:creator: Adrian Proszenko
item.description: Rule changes, the NRLW competition and proposed fine increases are just some of the topics to be broached at a landmark meeting of players on Tuesday.
item.title: Players meet to demand seat at table for game’s biggest issues

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: Alastair Clarkson informed the Blues he was not going to coach the club in 2022 after incoming CEO Brian Cook made a last-ditch attempt to woo the four-time premiership coach.
item.title: ‘I need a spell’: Clarkson out of Carlton coaching race

item.dc:creator: Jake Niall
item.description: The major talking point at the Brownlow Medal on Sunday was the enormous vote tallies garnered by the top contenders, especially the first four.
item.title: Explaining the Brownlow’s great mystery: vote inflation

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: Penrith back-rower Liam Martin successfully riled Cam Munster into giving away a penalty in the State of Origin opener - now he wants to repeat the tactic in Saturday’s preliminary final.
item.title: ‘I said something to him’: Martin out to reprise Munster Origin niggle

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: Christian Welch has terrorised Nathan Cleary more than any other player, but says “halfback bias” has crept into the game due to the number of retired playmakers in the commentary box.
item.title: ‘Halfback bias’: Storm star says No.7s over-represented in media

item.description: The move comes as Hong Kong’s property gauge dropped the most since May 2020 amid growing investor angst about China’s real estate crackdown and worries that Beijing may tighten grip on the city’s property sector.
item.title: Contagion worries as Chinese property developer Sinic sinks 87pc

item.dc:creator: Chip Le Grand
item.description: The research team whose work underpins Australia’s pandemic exit strategy believes the Delta strain of the virus is significantly more deadly than they assumed when the national plan was adopted.
item.title: Delta more deadly than national plan assumes

item.dc:creator: Sarah McPhee
item.description: The city is forecast to reach a maximum of 17 degrees on Tuesday as a cold air mass brings gusty winds and the chance of showers and small hail.
item.title: The windy city: Warm Sydney weather to drop by 10 degrees

item.dc:creator: Daniel Cherny
item.description: Several AFL clubs have tributes to Australian football’s founding father, Tom Wills, who has been linked to a massacre of Aboriginal people 160 years ago.
item.title: AFL clubs seek advice after Tom Wills discovery

item.dc:creator: Tom Rabe
item.description: The NSW government will splash the bulk of its COVID recovery spending in 15 western Sydney council areas, including many which faced the harshest lockdown measures of the Delta outbreak.
item.title: WestConnex cash set to flow to heavily locked down Sydney regions

item.dc:creator: Laura Chung
item.description: The call from the domestic violence sector follows reports some women have been disclosing their abuse at vaccine appointments because it’s one of the few times they have been able to leave their homes in months.
item.title: Push for domestic violence support in vaccine clinics, as lockdown leaves women vulnerable

item.dc:creator: Clay Lucas
item.description: Sunday’s road map out of lockdown gave clarity to millions of Victorians. But for thousands of companies struggling to survive since last March, it could spell the end.
item.title: Road map good for some, driving others to wall, as lockdown grinds on

item.dc:creator: Greg Baum
item.description: Adam Woolcock uses the shorthand of a fan to annotate what the Demons have endured since their last premiership win in 1964.
item.title: The monstrous losses and scant triumphs seared into Melbourne’s soul

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: The NSW government has knocked back the Australian Turf Club’s push to have 15,000 people at The Everest.
item.title: The Everest capped at 5000 people with 70 per cent vax

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: David Teague has joined Richmond as an assistant coach less than a month after Carlton sacked him with one year remaining on his contract.
item.title: Teague joins Tigers as an assistant

item.dc:creator: Natassia Chrysanthos
item.description: Science network OzSAGE said schools should be given the same treatment as NSW Parliament, where the upper house’s ventilation system has been upgraded to ensure eight exchanges of fresh air every hour.
item.title: ‘Schools should be made safer’: Scientists say NSW needs better plan for ventilation

item.dc:creator: Georgina Mitchell
item.description: Carly McBride was killed by Sayle Kenneth Newson, who brutally assaulted her and dumped her body in bushland in 2014. She was found two years later.
item.title: Domestic violence murder of ‘happy, gorgeous’ woman motivated by jealousy, court told

item.dc:creator: Adam Pengilly
item.description: The club’s directors didn’t proceed with a scheduled meeting to dissect the internal review, a guide to their decision on the coach’s future.
item.title: Stay of execution? Tigers delay call on Maguire as meeting abandoned

item.dc:creator: Kerrie O'Brien
item.description: Long before Snugglepot and Cuddlepie, the children’s’ author wrote a book about “a dear, nice little girl” and her dog,
item.title: May Gibbs’ picture book published for the first time in Australia

item.dc:creator: Nick Bonyhady
item.description: StarTrack, which is owned by Australia Post, has asked the industrial tribunal to cancel a 24-hour strike planned for Thursday.
item.title: Transport company claims strike will put vaccine supplies at risk

item.dc:creator: Rob Harris
item.description: Some Labor MPs believe the party should not offer immediate support for the decision to sign a deal for nuclear submarines with the US and UK.
item.title: Veteran Labor senator demands Senate inquiry into AUKUS submarines pact

item.dc:creator: David Estcourt
item.description: Joseph Hitchcock and Luke Sheahan were charged with affray over the brawl but did not have direct involvement in the teenager’s death.
item.title: Two men involved in brawl that led to death of teenager Patrick Cronin avoid jail

item.dc:creator: The Herald's View
item.description: Australia’s corporate boardrooms, like its parliaments, remain too “pale and male”. But diversity in leadership is still a goal worth chasing for business and politics alike.
item.title: Increased boardroom diversity needs to go beyond gender

item.description: sdfs
item.title: Three-year-olds to the fore on Central Coast

item.description: China Evergrande Group bondholders are about to find out if the property giant’s liquidity crisis is as dire as it appears.
item.title: China’s Evergrande moment of truth arrives with bond payment deadlines

item.dc:creator: Sam McClure
item.description: As a long-serving Demon, and a family man, Tom McDonald feels the pain of separation and of the fans’ separation from this grand moment. He just hopes they’re proud of what they watch each week.
item.title: Tom McDonald’s message to his two families

item.dc:creator: Simone Fox Koob
item.description: Chana Rabinowitz told a court she was advised against making a statement to police about former school principal and accused child abuser Malka Leifer in case she was later sued.
item.title: Social worker advised not to give statement on Malka Leifer, court hears

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: Research by the Reserve Bank suggests more than 250 suburbs are at risk from house price falls due to climate change.
item.title: Climate change to deliver suburban house price pain: RBA

item.description: The United Russia party is expected to maintain its grip over the lower house, with opposition parties and independent observers claiming widespread fraud.
item.title: ‘Ballot stuffing’: Putin’s party wins election but loses some ground
